SEARCH
Package executor.service.service.executor

Class ScenarioExecutorService

java.lang.Object
executor.service.service.executor.ScenarioExecutorService
All Implemented Interfaces:
ScenarioExecutor
@Service public class ScenarioExecutorService extends Object implements ScenarioExecutor
Service class implementing the ScenarioExecutor interface for executing scenarios.

The ScenarioExecutorService class serves as an implementation of the ScenarioExecutor interface, providing logic for interpreting and executing scenarios using a WebDriver instance. As a service class, it is typically used within a larger application context or as part of a scenario-driven testing framework.

It is annotated with @Service, indicating that this class is a Spring service bean, which may be managed and injected by the Spring IoC container.

The class includes an implementation of the ScenarioExecutor.execute(Scenario, WebDriver) method, where each step of the provided Scenario is interpreted and executed using the provided WebDriver.

It is recommended to use this service class in collaboration with other components of the application, such as scenario definition classes and WebDriver initialization classes, to enable end-to-end scenario execution and testing.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public ScenarioResult execute(Scenario scenario, org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver webDriver)
      Executes the given scenario using the provided WebDriver instance.

      The execute method interprets and executes the steps defined within the provided Scenario using the given WebDriver instance. It navigates to the site specified in the scenario, performs each step, and returns a ScenarioResult object representing the result and outcome of the scenario execution.

      The method takes two parameters:

      • scenario: The Scenario object representing the scenario to be executed. It contains the sequence of steps and associated data defining the behavior of the scenario.
      • webDriver: The WebDriver instance for interacting with the web application. This WebDriver is used to perform actions specified in the scenario, such as clicking elements, navigating between pages, or interacting with web elements.

      The method follows these steps:

      1. Navigates to the site specified in the scenario using webDriver.get(scenario.getSite()).
      2. Calls executeSteps(Scenario, WebDriver) to interpret and execute each step of the scenario.
      3. In case of an exception during execution, logs the error and returns a ScenarioResult object indicating a failed scenario execution.
      4. Regardless of the outcome, calls webDriver.quit() to close the WebDriver instance.

      It is recommended to use this method within a scenario-driven testing framework, where scenarios are defined using Scenario objects, and their execution is carried out by classes implementing the ScenarioExecutor interface.

      Specified by:
      execute in interface ScenarioExecutor
      Parameters:
      scenario - The scenario to be executed.
      webDriver - The WebDriver instance for interacting with the web application.
      Returns:
      A ScenarioResult object representing the result of the scenario execution.
